revised_title: Synaptic Transmission: Subcellular and Macromolecular Aspects
tldr: This article discusses the subcellular and macromolecular aspects of synaptic transmission, focusing on biochemical studies of adrenergic neurons. It explores the role of enzymes, cell organelles, and proteins in the process, as well as the concept of exocytosis in releasing neurotransmitters. The author emphasizes the importance of interdisciplinary collaboration between physiologists, biochemists, and cytologists to understand the complex mechanisms of synaptic transmission.
